TextBlock.Text: DITYLUM: Yikes, I see what Karenia was getting so worked up about, this place is really creepy. It feels unnatural, like the <color=purple>Bramble</color> doesn’t want it here. I’m just going to poke around a little bit and then leave. I can’t believe that the Nomai can stand to be here for more than a few minutes.
DITYLUM: Okay, that’s probably not good. There was a massive creaking sound a few minutes ago, like wood splintering. Probably about time for me to take my leave.

DITYLUM: Okay, definitely not good. When I exit this dimension, it seems like I end up on the far side of the <color=orange>Nursery</color>, instead of near <color=orange>Shattered Hearth</color>. I don’t really have any way to get across with all of the baby fish there, so I guess I’ll sit here and wait for rescue.
DITYLUM: Okay, so, it’s been a few hours now, and nobody’s come. Are they not able to get across the <color=orange>Nursery</color>? I hadn’t even considered that. Am I going to die here?

DITYLUM: It’s been a couple of days now, and still no sign of anyone. I’m starting to lose hope. Maybe the Nomai are trying to find a way, but after this long, I’m probably already being mourned back home. Maybe I should chance it with the fish? I know that I won’t starve for another week or so, but it’s hard to tell if starvation is better than being eaten alive.
DITYLUM: No, no, I know that they won’t give up, I just need to give them time.

DITYLUM: I’m really starting to get desperate now, I’ve been in here for about a week and nobody is coming. I think it’s time, I’m either going to make it across in one piece now, or not at all. Wait, hold on... is that somebody? Four somebodies?! The Nomai! By the <color=purple>Bramble</color>, they actually figured out a way across!
